intro: Vangueria schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Vangueria schliebenii is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
